Netflix price target raised to $740 from $643 at Credit SuisseNetflix price target raised to $740 from $643 at Credit Suisse Credit Suisse analyst Douglas Mitchelson raised the firm's price target on Netflix to $740 from $643 and keeps an Outperform rating on the shares. The analyst notes that Squid Game's success has raised investor Q3/Q4 subscriber expectations accordingly, with his recent discussions with investors suggesting an expectation of 4M/8M net adds for Q3/Q4 guide, but only because it is universally anticipated that management will be overly conservative. While Mitchelson acknowledges the set-up into earnings is heady, a Q3 miss seems off the table, the Q4 slate is terrific, and management commentary is likely to be quite optimistic with Squid Game the latest evidence proving out its international content strategy.

breaking: Netflix reiterates Overweight and raises price target raised to $705 from $625 at J.P. MorganJPMorgan analyst Doug Anmuth raised the firm's price target on Netflix to $705 from $625 and reiterates an Overweight rating on the shares. The streaming service closed Tuesday up $16.18 to $606.71. The analyst continues to like Netflix shares toward year-end based on strength of its second half of the year content slate, "greater distance from pandemic pull-forward," and the "significant global secular streaming opportunity" with Netflix "only" 20%-25% penetrated. He believes the company's user trends continue to improve from Q2 levels.

I hold both NFLX and DIS shares however DIS has proven to be a major disappointment so far. I will hold both for a few more months but if DIS doesn’t start performing the way NFLX has I am selling DIS to buy more NFLX. Some like to say competition is intensify for NFLX, however that has failed to impact their earnings as well as erode management effectiveness, aka return on assets, return on equity, and return on invested capital. Those have continued to increase despite the competition, which tells me NFLX still has a competitive advantage. As long as they continue to churn out blockbusters like The Queen’s Gambit and Squid Game the competition will be playing catch up. In addition to that, NFLX and DIS have different target markets with their shows so it’s not exactly an apples to apples comparison. I know there are people out there that use Peacock, I have yet to meet them though. Lifting the hood one can tell NFLX is really not in any serious trouble. Fundamentally the stock is growth at a reasonable price and cash flow is increasing by the quarter. When the engine begins to sputter I’ll concede the bear case, but right now it is firing on all cylinders.

Amazon Jeff Bezos, Second Richest, Wants to Watch "Squid Game" .The addictive K-drama is raking in viewership globally at a rapid rate such that it might surpass current ranking record holder Bridgerton. Squid Game is tracking to be its biggest show ever, and is currently ranking as the No.1-show on the platform in 83-countries. The show is going to soon become the biggest non-English-language Netflix show and perhaps top Bridgerton’s record 82 million. Bridgerton at the top of the streaming giant’s most popular shows is followed by Lupin Part 1, The Witcher Season 1, Sex/Life Season 1, and Season 3 of Stranger Things.

With 44 wins, including the two most coveted awards of the night:Best Drama and Best limited Series.Powered by multiple wins for “The Crown” and “The Queen’s Gambit,” streaming giant Netflix reclaimed the top spot among all TV platforms on the 73rd Emmy Awards presented Sunday.The Las Gatos-based company swamped the competition with a total of 44 trophies.The wins pushed Netflix well ahead of second-place HBO, which finished with 19 trophies.https://www.latimes.com/entertainment-arts/business/story/2021-09-19/emmys-2021-television-awards-scorecard-netflix-queens-gambit

NFLX reiterated Overweight with $645 price target at KeyBancAs Netflix's content slate kicks into gear, KeyBanc analyst Justin Patterson reminds investors that content resonates differently across regions. Shows like "Money Heist" resonate in select international markets, while "The Witcher" and "Stranger Things" have domestic and international audiences, Patterson adds. Given content timing, his view is international leads the net add recovery in Q3, followed by a broader recovery in Q4. The analyst maintains an Overweight rating and a price target of $645 on the shares.

I'd really like to know what do you, NFLX shareholders or traders, think about ViacomCBS (VIAC).Both NFLX and VIAC operate in the same business - media and entertainment. VIAC's portfolio includes streaming service Paramount+, which is not so well-known as Netflix, but it's number of subscribers is rapidly growing, while IMO NFLX growth is somewhat limited (almost everyone interested probably already got it).There are 2 main differences between NFLX and VIAC :1) VIAC is not only about series and films, but their portfolio includes also sports, CBS, PlutoTV, MTV etc, which means a revenue from adds2) VIAC owns huge content library - Paramount Pictures, which means a revenue from licensing.The revenues of both are almost the same : NFLX 27.59B, VIAC 26.69B, the debt of both also almost equal.And now the most interesting numbers - market cap : NFLX 283B, VIAC 26B.That means NFLX is valued more than 10times vs. VIAC.I'd really like to know your opinion.
